aiGenerator.name: Name:
aiGenerator.noDocument: No document selected. Please open the AI Assistant from the title bar button of a character sheet or item form.
aiGenerator.userRequestHint: Describe how you want the AI to modify the current document
aiGenerator.userRequestPlaceholder: For example: 'Increase weapon damage, add fire trait, raise level to 5.' or 'Help me write a background story, highlighting the character's warrior identity and northern origin.'
aiGenerator.mechanicsKnowledgeTooltip: When enabled, AI will reference complete PF2e rule mechanics knowledge to generate more balanced modification suggestions
aiGenerator.mechanicsKnowledgeHint: ðŸ’¡ Recommended: AI will understand action systems, modifier types, damage balance and other core rules
aiGenerator.pleaseOpenFromDocument: Please open AI Assistant from document form first

apiUrl.name: API URL (GM)
apiUrl.hint: AI service API URL for GM use, such as OpenAI, 302.AI and other compatible API endpoints

apiKey.name: API Key (GM)
apiKey.hint: API key for GM use, for unrestricted AI function access

playerApiUrl.name: API URL (Player)
playerApiUrl.hint: AI service API URL for player use. Players can use this API for limited functions (such as shrine system, AI icon generation). Leave blank to use GM's API URL

playerApiKey.name: API Key (Player)
playerApiKey.hint: API key for player use, for limited AI function access (shrine system, AI icon generation). Leave blank to disable AI functions for players

aiModel.name: AI Model
aiModel.hint: AI model name to use, please enter the correct model name according to your API service

imageApiUrl.name: Image Generation API URL (GM)
imageApiUrl.hint: Image generation API URL for GM use (such as DALL-E, Midjourney, etc.). Leave blank to use main API URL. Most third-party APIs don't support image generation, separate configuration recommended

imageApiKey.name: Image Generation API Key (GM)
imageApiKey.hint: Image generation API key for GM use. Leave blank to use main API key

playerImageApiUrl.name: Image Generation API URL (Player)
playerImageApiUrl.hint: Image generation API URL for player use. Leave blank to fallback in order: GM image API URL â†’ Player main API URL â†’ GM main API URL

playerImageApiKey.name: Image Generation API Key (Player)
playerImageApiKey.hint: Image generation API key for player use. Leave blank to fallback in order: GM image API key â†’ Player main API key â†’ GM main API key

testConnection.name: Test AI Connection
testConnection.label: Test Connection
testConnection.hint: Test if the connection to the AI service is working properly

terminologyImporter.name: PF2e Terminology Management
terminologyImporter.label: Terminology Management
terminologyImporter.hint: Import and manage PF2e professional terminology glossary

balanceKeywordsManager.name: Balance Keywords Management
balanceKeywordsManager.label: Balance Management
balanceKeywordsManager.hint: Manage custom numerical balance keyword configurations

activeTheme.name: Interface Theme
activeTheme.hint: Select the theme style for the shrine synthesis system

debugMode.name: Debug Mode
debugMode.hint: When enabled, detailed debug logs will be displayed in the F12 console (module loading, UI interaction, drag recognition, etc.). When disabled, only synthesis process, AI calls, and error/warning messages will be shown

terminology.name: Terminology Data
terminology.hint: Moved to module directory storage, this setting is only for backward compatibility

autoCollectTerminology.name: Auto Collect New Terminology
autoCollectTerminology.hint: When enabled, new proper nouns identified by AI during translation will be automatically added to the terminology list

enableIconGeneration.name: Enable Icon Generation
enableIconGeneration.hint: When enabled, icons will be automatically generated for created items and monsters

imageModel.name: Image Generation Model
imageModel.hint: Select the AI model to use for icon generation

useShrineSystem.name: Enable Shrine System
useShrineSystem.hint: When enabled, use the Aztec mythology-based shrine synthesis system, replacing the original feat synthesizer

shrineDesignModel.name: Shrine - Design Model
shrineDesignModel.hint: AI model name for creative design of feat/spell core concepts (Recommended: grok-beta for creativity, gpt-4o for balance)

shrineFormatModel.name: Shrine - Format Conversion Model
shrineFormatModel.hint: AI model name for converting designs to PF2e format (feat/spell universal, Recommended: gpt-4o for good Function Calling support)

shrineDirectModel.name: Shrine - Direct Generation Model
shrineDirectModel.hint: AI model name for directly generating complete feats/spells (Recommended: gpt-4o for good balance)

shrineIconPromptModel.name: Shrine - Icon Prompt Model
shrineIconPromptModel.hint: AI model name for generating icon prompts (feat/spell universal, Recommended: gpt-4o-mini is sufficient)

shrineEnableDesignPhase.name: Shrine - Enable Design Phase
shrineEnableDesignPhase.hint: When enabled, will first call the design agent to integrate shrine material information and formulate a plan, then pass to the generation agent

shrineEnableFormatPhase.name: Shrine - Enable Format Phase
shrineEnableFormatPhase.hint: When enabled, will use formatting agent to strictly convert to PF2e format after generation (recommended to enable for format correctness)

shrineSpellEnableDesignPhase.name: Shrine Spell - Enable Design Phase
shrineSpellEnableDesignPhase.hint: When enabled, will first call the design agent to integrate shrine material information and formulate a plan, then pass to the generation agent

shrineSpellEnableFormatPhase.name: Shrine Spell - Enable Format Phase
shrineSpellEnableFormatPhase.hint: When enabled, will use formatting agent to strictly convert to PF2e format after generation (recommended to enable for format correctness)

autoCollectTerminology.name: Auto Collect New Terms
autoCollectTerminology.hint: When enabled, new proper nouns identified by AI during translation will be automatically added to the terminology glossary

useShrineSystem.name: Enable Shrine System
useShrineSystem.hint: When enabled, the Aztec mythology-based shrine synthesis system will be used, replacing the original feat synthesizer

ui.paramsHint: Can be JSON parameters or simple text description

errors.noKey: API key not set. Please set it in the module settings.

equipment.title: Equipment Generation
equipment.descriptionHint: Describe the type of equipment you want to generate. Can be weapons, armor, tools, or magical items
equipment.descriptionPlaceholder: For example: 'A magical weapon crafted by ancient elven artisans, imbued with natural forces, with unique appearance and abilities. Suitable for druids or rangers.' or 'Heavy armor forged from rare metals, providing powerful protection for knights and warriors.'
equipment.traitsHint: Enter expected PF2e traits, separated by commas. These traits will be used to search for similar reference items
equipment.enableCompendiumHint: When enabled, will search official equipment compendia for generation reference

consumable.title: Consumable Generation
consumable.descriptionHint: Describe the type of consumable you want to generate. Can be potions, scrolls, bombs, or other one-time items
consumable.descriptionPlaceholder: For example: 'Various alchemist potions, including healing potions, enhancement elixirs, poisons, and practical tools. With different effects and rarities.' or 'Magic scrolls transcribed by wizards, containing various spell effects, suitable for different classes.'
consumable.traitsHint: Enter expected PF2e traits, separated by commas. These traits will be used to search for similar reference items
consumable.enableCompendiumHint: When enabled, will search official consumable compendia for generation reference

Explorer.title: PF2e Data Structure Explorer
Explorer.description: This tool helps understand item and actor data structures in the PF2e system

analysis.title: Data Structure Analysis
analysis.placeholder: Please select an item to analyze...

FeatGenerator.title: PF2e Feat Generator
FeatGenerator.promptPlaceholder: Describe the feat effect you want, for example: a feat that allows quick movement in combat
FeatGenerator.enableCompendium: Enable Compendium Search (search related content for reference)

manualImport.title: Manual Import Feat
manualImport.intro: Automatic import failed, please import manually:

FeatureGenerator.title: Feature Generator
FeatureGenerator.description: Use AI to generate unique Pathfinder 2e class features. The system will design through three collaborative agents: Mechanism Design â†’ Feature Design â†’ Format Conversion.
FeatureGenerator.featureDescriptionPlaceholder:
Describe the feature you want, for example:
- A resource management mechanism based on fire
- A system similar to skill cooldowns in MOBA games
- An ability to switch between different stances in combat
- A hand management mechanism referencing card games
FeatureGenerator.compendiumSearchHint: AI will extract keywords from the prompt and search PF2e compendia for relevant content as design reference. This helps generate features more consistent with official style.
AI will extract keywords from the prompt and search PF2e compendia for relevant content as design reference. This helps generate features more consistent with official style.
FeatureGenerator.step1Description: AI first designs unique game mechanics, considering balance and extensibility
FeatureGenerator.step2Description: Converts mechanics into specific PF2e features, including rule elements
FeatureGenerator.step3Description: Converts to standard Foundry VTT item format
FeatureGenerator.suggestion1: Describe the type of mechanism you want (resource management, state switching, trigger effects, etc.)
FeatureGenerator.suggestion2: Can reference mechanics from other games (MOBA, card games, board games, etc.)
FeatureGenerator.suggestion3: Explain the feature's usage scenarios and target effects
FeatureGenerator.suggestion4: Mention any special balance requirements or restrictions
FeatureGenerator.balanceDataDescription: The system will display appropriate balance reference data based on the selected level to help ensure generated features meet PF2e numerical standards.
FeatureGenerator.note1: Generation process may take 1-2 minutes, please be patient
FeatureGenerator.note2: Generated features need GM review before use in game
FeatureGenerator.note3: Can generate the same concept multiple times to get different implementations
FeatureGenerator.note4: Use the balance check function to evaluate feature strength
FeatureGenerator.promptPlaceholder: Describe the class feature you want to generate...
FeatureGenerator.generatingInfo: Starting feature generation, this may take some time...

manualImport.title: Manual Import Feature
manualImport.intro: Automatic import failed, please import manually:

FeatureGenerator.levelInfo: Feature design focuses on mechanical innovation. For detailed numerical balance, refer to the Feat Generator.

FragmentGenerator.title: PF2e Fragment Generator
FragmentGenerator.createSingleDescription: Use AI to generate fragments based on requirement descriptions
FragmentGenerator.generateSetDescription: Use AI to automatically generate a set of related fragments based on a theme
FragmentGenerator.requirementHint: Describe the fragment effects and theme you want in detail, AI will generate appropriate fragments
FragmentGenerator.rolePoint1: Fragments only provide [Flavor Elements] and [Effect Content]
FragmentGenerator.rolePoint2: Not responsible for core mechanic design (mechanics provided by divinity or AI design)
FragmentGenerator.rolePoint3: Effect content can be directional guidance, not necessarily complete rules
FragmentGenerator.requirementPlaceholder: Describe the fragment's purpose or effect...
FragmentGenerator.themePlaceholder: Describe the theme of the fragment set...
FragmentGenerator.createSetSuccess: Fragment set created! {count} fragments created in world.

preview.title: Fragment Preview
preview.name: Fragment Name
preview.confirmSet: Confirm and Create All to World

FeatStorage.title: Feat Storage
FeatStorage.confirmDeleteFeat:
Are you sure you want to delete feat {name} from storage?

This action cannot be undone.
FeatStorage.confirmDeleteSpell:
Are you sure you want to delete spell {name} from storage?

This action cannot be undone.
FeatStorage.confirmClearFeats:
Are you sure you want to delete all {count} feats from normal storage?

Feats in confirmed storage will not be deleted.

This action cannot be undone!
FeatStorage.confirmClearSpells:
Are you sure you want to delete all {count} spells from normal storage?

Spells in confirmed storage will not be deleted.

This action cannot be undone!
FeatStorage.normalStorageInfo: (Synthesized feats will enter this area first)
FeatStorage.normalStorageEmpty: Normal storage is empty. Synthesized feats will automatically enter this area.
FeatStorage.normalSpellStorageEmpty: Normal storage is empty. Synthesized spells will automatically enter this area.
FeatStorage.confirmedStorageInfo: (Feats dragged to this area will not be cleared)
FeatStorage.confirmedStorageEmpty: Confirmed storage is empty. Drag important feats to this area, they will not be cleared.
FeatStorage.confirmedSpellStorageEmpty: Confirmed storage is empty. Drag important spells to this area, they will not be cleared.
